alert.note: Alert for City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 4:05PM EDT until August 10 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, City of Hampton, City of Newport News, City of Poquoson, City of Williamsburg, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area during the next 30 to 60 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Williamsburg, Patrick Henry Field, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, Seaford, Christopher Newport University, Queens Lake, Langley AFB, College Of William And Mary, Lee Hall, Denbigh, Fort Eustis, Tabb, Grove, Busch Gardens, Beaconsdale, Carver Gardens and York Terrace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson; York
